org.sd.util
Class WindowString

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.WindowString

public class WindowString
extends java.lang.Object

Utility to keep a window of characters.

Author:
Spence Koehler

append

public boolean append(java.lang.String string)
Append the given string to this instance.

If a centerPos has not been set, then keep adding content, rolling the window to drop earlier chars in favor of keeping later chars.

If a centerPos has been set and no more chars will fit in the window after adding what could be added from string, then this string is full and no more content will be added.

Returns:
false, if no more content will be added to this window.

append

public boolean append(java.lang.String string,
                      int centerPos)
Append the given string to this instance, setting the centerPos to be at the identified position within the given string (not this window's contents).

Parameters:
string - The string to append to this window.
centerPos - The position in 'string' that is to be centered in this window.
Returns:
false, if no more content will be added to this window.

append

public boolean append(java.lang.String string,
                      int[] centerPos)
Append the given string to this instance, setting the centerPos to be at the identified position within the given string (not this window's contents).

Parameters:
string - The string to append to this window.
centerPos - The position in 'string' that is to be centered in this window. In this case, centerPos[0] will be interpreted as a character position in string and centerPos[1] will be interpreted as the length of a substring in string. The actual center will be at the center of said substring.
Returns:
false, if no more content will be added to this window.

reset

public void reset()
Clear out this instance to re-use or start over.
